column4: does anyone have a step by step walk through for me to get this specific model of wireless usb adapter working on ubuntu (its not supported out of box):Linksys  WUSB54GSC
: they come in several versions all with different chipsets. which is yours?
version 2.0 is the one i've been able to use succesfully on windows
please see  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1247163&highlight=WUSB54GSC  it looks like ndiswrapper is the method. what does lsusb say it is?
to do that, i would need to install ndiswrapper, which means i'd need working internet, which is what i'm trying to achieve by getting the wireless adapter recognized
i think the ndiswrapper packages are on the install CD. do you have the driver cd for the devive that has the windows inf file?
im not sure, never messed with drivers like this before..dont really know any of the terminology here
can you give us the Linksys part of the terminal command lsusb? maybe we can find a better way
i can do that, i suppose I'll need to reboot and run taht command and then reboot again...
i will be here. i am especially interested in the usb.id, something like 123e:456a
i cannot connect to internet on ubuntu though
can you just write it down? maybe there is a way with a usb key
ran lsusb -v, you want me to pastebin output or is there a certain line you seek
is there a line that relates to your Linksys? i need the usb.id, something like 123a:456b
is there anything about Broadcom?
everything i have read says ndiswrapper. i will be happy to assist you on the forum. it's a bit lengthy to go through here
perhaps ill only be here for another day, maybe its not worth it
if you need to get it going, post on the forum and give me a private message and i'll help you
sounds good, whats your SN?
on the forum, i am chili555
